text: @JWBeee_ @Anankastiac Accepting everyone‚Äôs personality (or way of being) is the core principle of the neurodiversity paradigm, by the way. text:
Just an extra little tweet for anyone who isn't keyed up on neurodiversity, as an aside: 

Not all autistic people have a medical diagnosis. 

Some people self-diagnose after a lot of research.

A medical diagnosis is difficult to obtain and a privilege.

Self-diagnosis is valid.

text:
Neurodiversity-affirming counselling helped me realize I spent years thinking:
"I'm broken because I can't do that."
"I'm failing at fixing myself to be able to do that."

But what actually works for me is asking: "What are the conditions necessary for me to be able to do that?"

text:
This is a message for any neurodivergent people.
The media is always going to try to make you look bad, incapable, lazy, whiney, overly sensitive, brittle, or a stereotype for suicidal people.
Be that example that makes the public doubt what the media says about neurodiversity.

text:
@AthosAp @AutSciPerson The term "allistic" is not literal at all. It is an arbitrarily assigned neologism that carries no context of its own. There's no way to guess at what it means unless you go searching for a definition.

The terms "neurodiversity" and "neurodivergent" DO bring context with them.
tokenized_text: <user> <user> the term " allistic " is not literal at all . it is an arbitrarily assigned neologism that carries no context of its own . there ' s no way to guess at what it means unless you go searching for a definition . the terms " neurodiversity " and " neurodivergent " do bring context with them .

text:
and obligatory caveat that when I say *my* ADHD I mean *my* ADHD, not "everybody's ADHD" and not "ADHD people are/need ___."

Not everyone experiences ADHD the same way and not everyone benefits from the same coping strategies; neurodiversity is diverse.

text:
NeuroDiversity - Judy Singer's concept RE: diversity in ALL human brains (including NeuroTypicals)

NeuroDivergent - people whose brains "diverge" from what's considered typical by society. 

NeuroDiverse - used when talking about the diversity in all brains - includes NT's

Noped out on the ADHD course again. (It's fine, I'm 34% through the 12 hour course.)
